name: Chenyu Vale
desc:
The gentle breezes carry the fragrance of tea all across the mountains of Liyue, filling the air with the savory scent once more.

"Tea grows upon the rocks, where jade springs endlessly flow." The faint perfume and ancient song of jade drift together along the rivers past Qiaoying Village to the bustling port of Yilong Wharf. Just what adventures and fortune await, concealed among the fog-robed peaks of the south...?

imgDesc.text: "... The spring's cries ripple through the vales, the shrines depart from the northeast shores. The heights and shallows in the southwest hide, sun and earth from each other divide, the eternal whirlpool that never churns, beautiful jade concealed within..."

galleryCharacter.key: The Clouds Cascade Around the Wharf

imgDesc.text: If one follows the Bishui River upstream, the prosperous merchant port built next to a vast waterfall will come into view. Here, the laughter of countless sailors and merchants and the calls of people buying and selling on every street form a unique scenic tapestry here at Liyue's northern edge.

An adeptus's abode, far from the din of mortal comings and goings. In the distant past, it is said that the ancestral peoples who had lost their home due to war were taken in by an adeptus named Fujin, and here did they avoid the disaster that raged without. Thus did the flame of civilization endure rather than be snuffed out under titanic floods.
The adeptus once revered as the "Herblord" has long since departed, and only empty medicinal containers remain. Even at war's very end, that desire to help those in need never once wavered.
"...Jade shall rise from sunken mouth... Gain and loss are inextricable, rise and fall, inseparable. Wax and wave is but a dream - the river flows as it ever has..."

In days gone by, when Guhua was at the height of its strength, various heroes from all walks of life would gather here, mingle, and drink, and the sound of song would never cease. Though the school's reputation has since waned, its magnificent hall still stands, inscribed with the "chivalry" of yesteryear.
"The weighty winds blow, yon' day is dark, the cascading falls flow clear."

In the tales told by older folks, the ancestral peoples of Chenyu Vale migrated here from the far south, and they built a mighty ritual tower to touch the heavens and left many mighty temples. The jade tower is no more, and only silent, ancient ruins stand amidst the thick fog that shrouds the mountains, watching over a secret none now shall know.
"Though stalwart stone may sink, it shall return rite-rightly."

In the long-forgotten mists of time, the ancestors of Chenyu Vale named this place the "Hanging Garden." Once-prosperous realms became divided into many tribes, and the tribes would later again unite into a prosperous realm, but the spirit veins of Chenyu Vale are as they ever were, gathering faithfully in this place.
"...Once this tree gets a bit larger, I'll pick its leaves and make some tea for all of you..."

galleryCharacter.key: The Bolossoming Warmth of Qiaoying Sunlight

imgDesc.text: When the gentle spring sun and winds caress the mountains of Chenyu, there will the rich fragrance of tea be accompanied by the dance of the Spiritscent Flower, just as in days past, drifting together through peaceful streets...
The final jade fell from here into the bottomless abyss. Here did the first wish become as but a river of smoke.

customize.text: Version 4.4 "Vibrant Harriers Aloft in Spring Breeze" Trailer

<color=#ffd780>January 19, 2024</color>
Spring has come early, and in its wake a rising beast, gazing up towards the clouds against an auspicious breeze. Soaring up like wild cranes the harlequin kites ascend, while a stream flows back through a vale of hidden treasures.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Stop Motion Animation: "Tidings of an Auspicious Beast"

<color=#ffd780>January 20, 2024</color>
Through Wushou Dance shall the propitious legend of the Suanni be told.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
"Chenyu Anecdotes": Version 4.4 New Contents Display Page

<color=#ffd780>January 23, 2024</color>
Greetings, Travelers! After the Version 4.4 update, new areas including "Chenyu Vale: Upper Vale," "Chenyu Vale: Southern Mountain," and "Mt. Laixin" will be available in Liyue. Check out this issue of Chenyu Anecdotes and see what special features these new areas have!

<color=#ffd780>March 27, 2024</color>
Genshin Impact's Chenyu Vale OST album "Jadeite Redolence" is now available! The album's two discs "Enthralled by the Spring Breeze" and "Clouds Over Lingmeng" feature 54 spectacular tracks composed by the HOYO-MiX team, each one an original composition for Chenyu Vale and its related storylines in Version 4.4.
<color=#ff9999>Disc 1:</color>

<color=#ffd780>January 21, 2025</color>
From the silent valley, a gentle breeze I embrace,
A lone boat drifts east, fading without a trace.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>

In ancient times, people carved jade as pure as fresh water and conducted festivals in solemn accord with their ancient traditions. Having waited for an auspicious day, the people would cease their onerous labors, and sacrifice their beautiful jade, throwing it into the water as respect. When the ancient god who once ruled Chenyu Vale had perished in foreign lands, and Rex Lapis's order assumed control of the land, those ancient forebears amidst their mountainous wilds slowly accepted the civilization of Liyue and lost the ancient art of carving jade jewelry. Today, only some artisans of Yilong Port still make such jade ornaments.
Yilong
is located north of Chenyu Vale and is one of the most important trading ports in the region, connecting Liyue and Fontaine. During one of the Lantern Rite Festivals, customers could buy Sunglo tea here with a fifty percent discount when buying 10 boxes. The port is home to the merchants Fengtai and Lianfang, as well as the Sword and Strongbox Secure Transport Agency, where Gaming works as a guard.

There are eight key nodes in Liyue's Ley Line network called the gates. One such node, the Gate of Life, is located at Yilong Wharf. The Gate of Life symbolizes growth, prosperity, and revitalization and is the most auspicious of all eight gates. When the fetor began to pass through the boundary between life and death during one of the Lantern Rites, the people of the port began to age rapidly. The Tianquan of the Liyue Qixing, Ningguang, and the owner of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor, Hu Tao, decided to use the Seven-and-Eight-Gates Method to hide the Gate of Death from the Ley Lines. The Yuheng of the Liyue Qixing, Keqing, went to Yilong Wharf to use the power of the gate and Director Hu's rattan figure to take on some of the fetor blast for her. In this way, the load would be distributed among all the gates, and Hu Tao would remain alive. After the situation with the Ley Lines was resolved, the fetor left the bodies of the sick, and they quickly recovered.
At the port, the following quests can be found:

customize.name: A Wangshan Walk to Remember
customize.desc: At Huang the Third's invitation, you arrive at the legendary place where the treasure of the Guhua Clan is located, Wangshan Hall...

customize.name: Our Chenyu Vale Trek
customize.desc: Hezhe Post seems to be organizing an interesting event named "Our Chenyu Vale Trek"...

customize.name: Temporary Acclimatization
customize.desc: The hydrologist Woliu seems distressed about something...

customize.name: Lantern Rite
customize.desc: Every year on the day of the first full moon, Liyue celebrates the Lantern Rite. At night, the people launch many Xiao Lanterns and one large Mingxiao Lantern into the sky. Inside each lantern is a piece of plaustrite and the heart's desires written on special sticks. The lanterns slowly float away, illuminating the way for the souls of Liyue's faithful defenders.

customize.name: Gaming
customize.desc: Guard of the Sword and Strongbox Secure Transport Agency, and the head of the "Mighty Mythical Beasts" Wushou troupe.

customize.name: Ningguang
customize.desc: The Tianquan of the Liyue Qixing. Her wealth is unsurpassed in all of Teyvat.

customize.name: Keqing
customize.desc: The Yuheng of the Liyue Qixing. Keqing has much to say about Rex Lapis's unilateral approach to policymaking in Liyue — but in truth, gods admire skeptics such as her quite a lot.

customize.name: Hu Tao
customize.desc: The 77th Director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. She took over the business at a rather young age.

customize.name: Woliu
customize.desc: A hydrologist working for the Ministry of Civil Affairs. She is currently conducting a routine survey of Chenyu Vale's hydrological and pedological conditions.

customize.name: Clearwater Jade
customize.desc: Jade from Chenyu Vale. Named for its cool, refreshing touch, that is much like clear water.

customize.text:
Mt. Mingyuan is located in the north of Chenyu Vale, west of Yilong Port. The Iron and Salt Gang operated on the mountain's territory and came into conflict with smugglers from Fontaine due to disagreements. With the help of the Milleliths, both the Iron and Salt Gang and the Fontaine gang were stopped, making the mountain safe to visit.
In this subarea, the quest

customize.name: The Dealing Sands
customize.desc: Two groups of unknown individuals are fighting fiercely in the wilderness. What in the world is going on?

customize.name: Iron Dou'er
customize.desc: An undercover Millelith. She is investigating the Iron and Salt Gang.

customize.text:
The Jademouth, located in the center of the vale on the Bishui River, is the main attraction of Chenyu Vale. There are two huge jade ornaments in the river. According to legend, they were thrown into the Bishui River by the carp Adeptus during the Archon War so that the earth would open up and swallow the river, preventing Liyue from flooding. There is a folk song about the Jademouth: <color=#ffffffd9>"...The spring's cries ripple through the vales, the shrines depart from northeast shores… The heights and shallows in the southwest hide, sun and earth from each other divide, the eternal whirlpool that never churns, the beautiful jade concealed within..."</color>
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Fujin
customize.desc: A carp Adeptus from Chenyu Vale.

customize.text:
The Chenlong Cleft, where the Votive Rainjade rested, lies under the Jademouth. Since ancient times, the Rainjade Rite has been performed in the vale, during which jade was thrown into the Bishui River. This Votive Rainjade is the final gemstone hurled by the Adeptus Fujin during the Archon War. Although it looks pretty much the same as other ordinary jade stones, it contains enough Adeptal energy to transform the nearby water and land in an instant.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Fujin
customize.desc: A carp Adeptus from Chenyu Vale.

customize.text:
Mt. Lingmeng is located southeast of Yilong Port in the Upper Chenyu Vale. Many centuries ago, the martial arts school, the Guhua Clan, was founded here, the main house of which was the "Lingmeng Chamber," now known as the Wangshan Hall. Now the hall is in decline and desolation, and only a few disciples of the Guhua Clan are trying to preserve the memory of the old days.
According to the village elders, the people of Mt. Lingmeng once worshipped many supernatural beings, walking alongside the spirit elders of fairies, birds, and beasts within the wild mountain. But in the earth-shaking chaotic war with the second who came a thousand years before, those gods, fairies, and former inhabitants alike disappeared. Only the Ley Lines retained the echoing memories, and thus they sometimes repeatedly reappear at dawn or at night, when fog and rain blanket the land. Sometimes, herb gatherers and jade artisans will lose their way in this fog and encounter these solitary shadows. The village elders say that encountering the ancient fallen is often an ill-starred omen, a sign of unexpected disaster. The Ley Lines bring forth these ancient regrets and miseries into the present world, and that is why there is fog and rain unceasing. That is why the mountain people avoid both like the plague, to avoid becoming entangled in spirit by those ancient sorrows.
When the Archon War just ended, a mariner once entered the crisscrossed streams beneath Mt. Lingmeng and became lost in the damp dusk fog. Following azure avians never before seen even in dreams, he came into the cavern of slumber. Through the jade glow, the mariner gazed at the inhabitants of old. Lined up and standing on the bank of a deep pool, they sang a song the mariner had never heard before:

<color=#ffffffd9>"How mine malice lurks lonesome in the dying light of day! How the hateful wind bears the rain, how the deep fog veils!"</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"None remain save a lone lord lamenting lost years — alas, alas! You came too late."</color>

When the figures stopped singing, they removed their jades and threw them into the pitch-black pool. Feeling despondency, the mariner quickly turned the paddle back and, leaving marks along the path, returned to Qiaoying Village. The Milleliths and surveyors tried to search for any mysterious settlements, but all without success. Only one doctor from Yilong Wharf, who entered Mt. Lingmeng in his youth, left a strange inkstone after his passing. Legend has it that it was the color of clear waters and bright as the high heavens.
In this subarea, the quests

customize.name: A Wangshan Walk to Remember
customize.desc: At Huang the Third's invitation, you arrive at the legendary place where the treasure of the Guhua Clan is located, Wangshan Hall...

customize.name: Scrolls and Sword Manuals of Guhua
customize.desc: Uncover the secret left behind by Guhua

customize.name: Shrouded Vale, Hidden Hero
customize.desc: Uncover the secret left behind by Guhua

customize.name: Archon War
customize.desc: The war for the divine thrones, declared by the Heavenly Principles. As a result of the Archon War that finished about 2000 years ago, seven rulers of seven nations received the Gnoses, the divine throne, and the title of an Archon.

customize.name: Xingqiu
customize.desc: A young man carrying a longsword who is frequently seen at book booths. He has a chivalrous heart and yearns for justice and fairness for all.

customize.name: Wen the Fourth
customize.desc: A member of the Guhua Clan.

customize.name: Huang the Third
customize.desc: Guhua Clan's head doorkeeper.

customize.text: Qiaoying Village is located in the northeast of Chenyu Vale and is famous for its tea. The village is the only place where tea trees grow. According to legend, this was caused by an ancient pact between the Adepti of the Vale. In Chenyu Vale, people believe that tea tasting is closer to a ritual people practice after a busy day to relieve themselves of the bustle and clear their minds. Each type of tea has its own traditions. Yunlai White Tea is shaped like a silver needle and should not be brewed with boiling water. The water must be allowed to cool until it's at 70% of its boiling temperature. First, wet the tea with some hot water, then pour an appropriate amount of water into the pot, and wait patiently for ten minutes until the tea turns a light amber hue. Only then should you take a sip. The brewing steps are reversed for Bishui Green Tea. It requires pouring the water first, then the tea leaves. A Single-Origin Yauwan Tea, one of the teas Chenyu Vale is famous for, requires brewing at high temperatures. Boiling water must be used after letting it stand for a short moment.

Chunming Teaworks is a tea processing workshop whose reputation extends far beyond Qiaoying Village. It utilizes traditional methods passed down for thousands of years to make tea alongside the best and newest machines for drying tea leaves and roasting tea, drawing out the fragrant aroma within. Perhaps this teaworks is the reason Qiaoying Village's tea is so famous.

In the center of the village, there is a large tea cauldron, which the Adeptus Cloud Retainer once gave to the villagers. In the depths of the village, there is the house of a herbalist who used to collect rare plants. He said that he had a divine plant in his yard that needed that sort of blessed water to grow. One day, he encountered monsters at Mt. Xuanlian while collecting blessed water, and never came back. Qiaoying Village is home to Gaming and Little Mao, a friend of the Mountain Lord.
The famous tea attracts tourists from all over Teyvat. So, during one of the Lantern Rite Festivals, the Director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor, Hu Tao, her consultant Zhongli, as well as guests from Fontaine: Iudex Neuvillette, Furina, Navia, and Clorinde visited the village.
In this subarea, the quests

customize.name: Threefold Expectations
customize.desc: Something seems to be wrong with three Monoliths within the mountains...

customize.name: Qiaoying, the Village of Many Tales
customize.desc: You once again meet the slightly paranoid author, Guijarro, in Qiaoying Village...

customize.name: Lantern Rite
customize.desc: Every year on the day of the first full moon, Liyue celebrates the Lantern Rite. At night, the people launch many Xiao Lanterns and one large Mingxiao Lantern into the sky. Inside each lantern is a piece of plaustrite and the heart's desires written on special sticks. The lanterns slowly float away, illuminating the way for the souls of Liyue's faithful defenders.

customize.name: Cloud Retainer
customize.desc: An Adeptus living on Mt. Aocang, Liyue.

customize.name: Gaming
customize.desc: Guard of the Sword and Strongbox Secure Transport Agency, and the head of the "Mighty Mythical Beasts" Wushou troupe.

customize.name: Little Mao
customize.desc: A child from Qiaoying Village and Lingyuan's friend.

customize.name: Lingyuan
customize.desc: An ancient Suanni from Chenyu Vale.

customize.name: Grandpa Lu
customize.desc: A Chunming Teaworks employee in Qiaoying Village.

customize.name: Uncle Luo
customize.desc: Qiaoying Village Chief.

customize.name: Jin
customize.desc: A Chunming Teaworks employee and Uncle Luo's apprentice.

customize.name: Hautemontagne
customize.desc: A researcher from the Fontaine Research Institute. She was sent to Qiaoying Village to repair the Three-Phase Asynchronous Elemental Tuner.

customize.name: Hu Tao
customize.desc: The 77th Director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. She took over the business at a rather young age.

customize.name: Zhongli
customize.desc: A mysterious expert contracted by the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. Extremely knowledgeable in all things.

customize.name: Furina
customize.desc: The absolute focus of the stage of judgment, until the final applause sounds.

customize.name: Navia
customize.desc: The current President of Spina di Rosula, who is lovely, dutiful, and a great boss.

customize.name: Neuvillette
customize.desc: The Chief Justice of Fontaine, known as the Iudex, is renowned for his unassailable impartiality.

customize.name: Chenyu Adeptea
customize.desc: Tea grown in warm, moist areas in Chenyu Vale. After millennia of careful cultivation, the tea today emits a rich fragrance that can be savored from several streets away.

customize.text:
A long time ago, the Adeptus Fujin planted the first tea tree on the top of the mountain, which belonged to the Suanni Lingyuan. It is believed that all the other tea trees in the vale grew from its branches. Although many years have passed, this tree is a symbol of the agreement concluded between the Adeptus and the Mountain Lord.
In this subarea, the quest

customize.name: The Roaming Abode
customize.desc: At night, out in the wild, you encounter a little girl standing on a bamboo raft...

customize.name: Fujin
customize.desc: A carp Adeptus from Chenyu Vale.

customize.name: Lingyuan
customize.desc: An ancient Suanni from Chenyu Vale.

customize.text:
Yaodie Valley is located in the east of the Southern Mountain of Chenyu Vale. During the Archon War, it became a refuge for people who had lost their homes.
On the east of Yaodie Valley the quest

customize.name: Chili Con Cloudy
customize.desc: You encounter an anxious merchant in a camp out in the wild...

customize.name: Wenhua
customize.desc: Owner of Yunyun and Chili Pepper.

customize.text:
In Yaodie Valley lies the Adeptus's Repose of the Adeptus known as Herblord. During the Archon War, she split some of her Adeptal energy off and injected it into the butterflies, greatly increasing their lifespan. Then, even if something would happen to the snake Adeptus, the mortals of Chenyu Vale might be able to follow the butterflies' guidance and find the formulae Herblord left behind.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Herblord
customize.desc: A snake Adeptus from Chenyu Vale.

customize.name: Ancient Tree Branch
customize.desc: A branch taken from an ancient tea tree. It emits a faint adeptal energy...

customize.text:
In Yaodie Valley, next to the Adeptus's Repose, lies Linghsu Courtyard. This was the place where Herblord made her medicine. The Adeptus left Chenyu Vale a long time ago, and only empty medicinal containers remained, but at the Archon War's very end, her desire to help those in need never once wavered. One day, Herblord planted an Adeptal Tree there, and although the tree withered after her departure, with the help of the butterflies, which contain her Adeptal energy, it can grow again.
In this subarea, the quest

customize.name: Silently the Butterfly Crosses the Valley
customize.desc: Yaodie Valley seems to conceal secrets unknown to all…

customize.name: Herblord
customize.desc: A snake Adeptus from Chenyu Vale.

customize.text:
Mt. Xuanlian is located in the south of Chenyu Vale on the border with Jueyun Karst. The mountain offers beautiful views of spectacular sunsets. It is believed that at the foot of this mountain, there is blessed water. To the east of Mt. Xuanlian is an earthen raft that can float even without water. On the raft is a strange grass, with large leaves and roots like young children, its name is Xiangjun. Its sound is like that of an infant, and it travels with the raft, smiling when it sees people and can ward off evil.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Xiangjun
customize.desc: A mysterious girl on an earthen raft.

customize.name: Xuanlian Sacred Water
customize.desc: If not for its name, this so-called "sacred water" sourced from the vicinity of Mt. Xuanlian would never have been regarded as anything special. On the contrary, when looking at it after knowing its name, you feel like you can see some adeptal aura rising from the water.

customize.text: The Chizhang Wall is located in the west of the Southern Mountain of Chenyu Vale. According to legends, these ruins were once numerous temples and a ritual jade tower that reached the heavens.

During the Archon War, the villagers were driven into the caves of this area by mountain beasts. People thought they were doomed until they met a great Adeptus of beauty beyond words, which this world has never seen. It was the Mountain Lord, Lingyuan, who was helping her friends, Fujin and Herblord.

Now the cave under the Chizhang Wall is the lair of the Solitary Suanni. These elegant and proud mystical beasts only live in the mountains, shrouded in Adeptal energy. Since ancient times, they have been considered a symbol of good fortune, and their preference for living aloof from the material world has been admired by intellectuals for generations. These days, the well-known Wushou Dance in Chenyu Vale came from the movements of the Suanni. However, since only a handful of people have actually seen such creatures, most can only imagine what they look like. After thousands of years of changes and different artistic interpretations, the Wushou Dance costume head has developed into its current style.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Archon War
customize.desc: The war for the divine thrones, declared by the Heavenly Principles. As a result of the Archon War that finished about 2000 years ago, seven rulers of seven nations received the Gnoses, the divine throne, and the title of an Archon.

customize.name: Lingyuan
customize.desc: An ancient Suanni from Chenyu Vale.

customize.name: Fujin
customize.desc: A carp Adeptus from Chenyu Vale.

customize.name: Herblord
customize.desc: A snake Adeptus from Chenyu Vale.

customize.name: Solitary Suanni
customize.desc:
These elegant and proud mystical beasts only live in mountains shrouded in adeptal energy.
Since ancient times, they have been considered a symbol of good fortune, and their preference for living aloof from the material world has been admired by intellectuals for generations. In ancient legends from Chenyu Vale, the leader of the suanni was called the Mountain Lord and was considered to be of the same standing as the adepti.
Another theory claims that the Xuanwen Beasts that roam the mountains these days are the descendants of the suanni, but that the thinning of their blood over the years has caused them to devolve into violent creatures. Although this contradicts another theory regarding the origin of Xuanwen Beasts, the few records of the suanni often show them attended by a large number of Xuanwen Beasts.
These days, the well-known Wushou Dance in Chenyu Vale came from the movements of the suanni. But since only a handful of people have actually seen such creatures, most can only imagine what they look like. After thousands of years of changes and different artistic interpretations, the Wushou Dance costume head has developed into its current style.

customize.text:
The Chiwang Terrace is located on the sacred Mt. Laixin, where all the spirit veins of the vale flow. On the terrace, there is a jade instrument, through which the ancestors of Chenyu Vale people could communicate with the heavens. In the long-forgotten mists of time, people named this place the "Hanging Garden."
In this subarea, the quest

customize.name: The Cloud-Padded Path to the Chiwang Repose
customize.desc: Paimon is a bit worried about Adeptus Fujin’s condition. If you have time, it might be good to pay another visit to Chiwang Terrace.

customize.text:
The ancestors of the people of Chenyu Vale once offered jade by throwing it into the waters, transferring Adeptal energy into spirit veins. Thus, their homeland was protected, and favorable weather was secured, guaranteeing abundant harvests. But today the ancient rites have long since been utterly forgotten. If the lost Adeptal energy could be gathered into the jade once more, then perhaps the blessings of the soil and water may be granted once more.
Inside Mt. Laixin there's the Carp's Rest, where the Adeptus Fujin was sealed for many years until she gained enough Adeptal energy. Since the northern Adepti cannot create the same abodes as the southern Adepti, her chambers are more like a "cave" than an abode. If you collect the Adeptal powers distributed throughout Chenyu Vale in the form of spirit carps and offer them to the Votive Rainjade located in the chambers, then Fujin will again be able to take on human form and leave her cave.
While entering Chenyu Vale for the first time, you will be teleported to the Carp's Rest to start the

customize.name: Chenyu's Blessings of Sunken Jade
customize.desc: A World Quest Series following the request of Fujin, an adeptus, to resolve the disharmony of Chenyu Vale's soil and water.

customize.name: Fujin
customize.desc: A carp Adeptus from Chenyu Vale.

customize.name: Spirit Carp
customize.desc: A Spirit Carp formed from the condensed adeptal energy, swimming freely amidst mountains and river valleys.

customize.name: Clearwater Jade
customize.desc: Jade from Chenyu Vale. Named for its cool, refreshing touch, that is much like clear water.

customize.name: Recipe: Chenyu Brew
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Chenyu Brew.

customize.name: Recipe: Tea-Smoked Squab
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Tea-Smoked Squab.

customize.name: Recipe: Jadevein Tea Eggs
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Jadevein Tea Eggs.

customize.name: Recipe: Fine Tea, Full Moon
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Fine Tea, Full Moon.

customize.name: Chenyu Adeptea
customize.desc: Tea grown in warm, moist areas in Chenyu Vale. After millennia of careful cultivation, the tea today emits a rich fragrance that can be savored from several streets away.

customize.name: Cloudseam Scale
customize.desc:
Cold and solid scales from a Solitary Suanni. They retain pure adeptal energy even after falling off and cannot be damaged by ordinary weapons.
Ordinary beasts can sometimes be affected by errant adeptal energy and become more powerful than usual. However, a suanni's adeptal energy originates from within themselves, which is why their leader is often regarded as equal to adepti.

customize.name: Spirit Carp
customize.desc: A Spirit Carp formed from the condensed adeptal energy, swimming freely amidst mountains and river valleys.

customize.name: Solitary Suanni
customize.desc:
These elegant and proud mystical beasts only live in mountains shrouded in adeptal energy.
Since ancient times, they have been considered a symbol of good fortune, and their preference for living aloof from the material world has been admired by intellectuals for generations. In ancient legends from Chenyu Vale, the leader of the suanni was called the Mountain Lord and was considered to be of the same standing as the adepti.
Another theory claims that the Xuanwen Beasts that roam the mountains these days are the descendants of the suanni, but that the thinning of their blood over the years has caused them to devolve into violent creatures. Although this contradicts another theory regarding the origin of Xuanwen Beasts, the few records of the suanni often show them attended by a large number of Xuanwen Beasts.
These days, the well-known Wushou Dance in Chenyu Vale came from the movements of the suanni. But since only a handful of people have actually seen such creatures, most can only imagine what they look like. After thousands of years of changes and different artistic interpretations, the Wushou Dance costume head has developed into its current style.

customize.name: Xuanwen Beast
customize.desc:
Xuanwen Beasts, named for the dark patterns on their bodies, are fierce creatures that inhabit the mountains of Chenyu Vale.
In the region's folklore, these beasts were the servants of an adeptus in ancient times, tasked with vanquishing evil and protecting the region. However, they devolved into brutal creatures after said adeptus passed away. These legends cannot be verified, and no one knows the true identity of this adeptus. This much is for sure, however — one should stay away from these aggressive creatures for one's safety.
For over a thousand years, these beasts have lost a tremendous amount of territory that once belonged to them to relentless human encroachment. These days, they can only occasionally be spotted in the remote mountains of Chenyu Vale...

customize.name: "Millennia of History Have Their Eyes on Us!"

customize.text:
Long ago, the people who now inhabit Chenyu Vale called the
their home. Their settlements stretched from peak to peak, and life was centered around the mines. But the ancient sin lying buried beneath their feet and shovels was unknown to the mortals, hidden under the deepest shafts. After the Divine Nail, which Celestia used to seal the spill of filth, fell on the mines, the people went north.

In ancient times, the ancestors of Chenyu Vale were able to communicate with the sky through jade. Celestia's emissaries, whose beauty was pure as moonlight, would lead and protect people. But after great changes in their "geology," they lost this ability. There's a legend saying that the jade scattered among the rocks came from the azure heavens. Celestia's envoys bestowed these beauteous gems upon the early residents and guided them to build a ritual jade altar that reached the heavens, so that they may receive the blessings and curses from above. While migrating from the south, people left many mighty temples and brought the ritual jade to Chiwang Terrace in Chenyu Vale. The jade tower is no more, and only silent, ancient ruins stand amidst the thick fog that shrouds the mountains, watching over a secret none now shall know. Later on, many tribes that descended from these ancestors kept this primordial, simple faith, and their reverence for jade was merged into the Liyue tradition, shaping the culture we see today.

When Rex Lapis had not yet become the ruler of this place, Chenyu Vale had its own goddess, who once fulfilled the dreams of many people. They say that she wore a skirt of coagulated jade-blood, and leaned on the long-destroyed lunar chariot, submerged and slumbering beneath a black, bottomless pool of water. Before the Archon War, she was the mistress of Chenyu Vale, who ruled the birds, beasts, and Adepti of wild mountain nature, who controlled the ebb and flow of the Bishui River, as an arbiter maintained the natural balance between mortals and animals. Two Adepti served this demon lord from the past: Herblord, whose real appearance was a white snake with golden eyes, and Fujin, a golden carp. One day, Fujin defeated the ancient Suanni, Lingyuan, known as the Mountain Lord, who lived in the vale before the arrival of the people. Fujin did not kill the Suanni but became her friend along with Herblord. Although Lingyuan did not like people, she allowed Fujin to perform the Rainjade Rite, which changed the ley lines and elemental energy so that people could live in the vale. Because of these changes, even the tea growing in Qiaoying Village began to taste something that people would like.

During the ritual, people threw magical jade into the river, which floated with the flow for a long time and then sank to the bottom. The last jade that people threw into the water before the ritual was forgotten during the Archon War was called the Votive Rainjade.
Herblord used to take the form of a woman with fair skin and golden eyes to heal the sick and create medicines. One day, she planted an Adeptal Tree and decorated the gates leading to this tree with colorful butterflies. Then the mechanism that powered the tree was destroyed and the tree dried up, but Herblord said that as long as the vivid butterflies did not fly away, the tree could be revived.

<color=#ffffffd9>"As the vivid butterflies converge in the jar, the adeptal energy surges anew, akin to new life restored to a withered tree..."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"...Born in winter, thriving and withering through time. But I yearn for spring when beauty is regained..."</color>

In ancient times, people carved statues of ritual spirits to protect their homes, which were called Sacred Simulacra. These owl-like statues can restore the spirit veins in Chenyu Vale.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Ancient Tree Branch
customize.desc: A branch taken from an ancient tea tree. It emits a faint adeptal energy...

customize.text:
Qiaoying Village is the only place in Liyue, where tea trees can grow, so it's famous for its tea business. People from the village believe that the Carp-Adeptus, Fujin, planted the first tea tree, so they held tea ceremonies in gratitude to this Adeptus. To help the village, Cloud Retainer once made a special cauldron, which has three connected monoliths specially designed to prevent chaotic elemental energy. One day, these three mechanisms started acting strangely, and tea masters invited a researcher from Fontaine, Hautemontagne, to investigate the problem. Thanks to her and the Traveler's help, elemental flow in the monoliths was restored, and the cauldron was repaired, allowing the village to start making tea again.
Chenyu Vale is famous not only for its tea but also for its crafts. Silver-smithing, jade-carving, cloth-dying, rattan-weaving, and countless other crafts — Chenyu Vale is famed as the home of the most outstanding and accomplished artisans in each field. Skilled, dextrous, and creative are but a few words that could be used to describe them. Many of these artisans have lived and worked together for generations, honing their crafts in the picturesque hamlet of Qiaoying Village. The village tradespeople chose to form a collective to protect their shared interests and now proudly announce themselves as members of the Chenyu Vale Artisans Association, spreading prestige for their hometown and their skills everywhere they go. Members of the association not only look out for each other in crafting and trade, but they form a close-knit, neighborly group who are always there for each other in good times and in bad.
When it comes time for the residents of Chenyu Vale to spruce up their homes, there is more than just the usual panoply of intricately carved wooden beds and tables on offer. They also have a fine selection of wickerwork furnishings to choose from — delicately crafted by their own master rattan weaver. The rattan weaving process consists of several stages: gathering the vines, processing them, and weaving them. Different vines are suitable for weaving different items. For example, a folding screen requires a certain stubborn resilience, while woven flower baskets, in contrast, require vines of a more supple nature. The most famous rattan weaver is a young girl named Lan Yan. Despite her youth, she excels at weaving all manner of rattan goods while also having a grasp on the arcane Qimen arts. It is said that <color=#ffffffd9>"skills honed to the highest pinnacle produce art that touches the divine realm."</color> The venerable masters believe that anyone who reaches the apex of their craft will uncover abilities that cut through the spiritual divide. To them, Lan Yan — with her Vision and attunement to the Qimen arts — is a truly remarkable young woman.

Much like the exorcists who dwell on Mt. Tianheng, the Lan clan, with their affinity for the Qimen arts, have long made Chenyu Vale their home. One such art requires the use of rattan figures, which is why weaving is so highly valued by the clan. The Lan family is also associated with the "Eight Adepts," who are significant figures in Liyue's history and once fought against the god Tao Dou. Of these eight heroes, the Jade-Plumed Silverwing, Lone Butterfly of the Crimson Flame, and Gold-Eyed Celadon Mare are known as the Three Beasts of Tao Dou. Of the remaining five, Wind Reader, the Wuwang Kid, and the Yunlai Angler were honored as the Three Hermits of Guizang. They and the Two Sages of Lianshan were all human. The Jade-Plumed Silverwing had a deep connection with Wind Reader, who was a truly remarkable individual. He came from the Twelve Tribes of Chenyu Vale and was the first to teach the Lan clan the secrets of the Qimen arts. This art involves Pentad Fortune Conveyance and Fate Transference, so many people are suspicious of it. When the owner of the Feiyun Commerce Guild fell seriously ill and went into a coma during the Lantern Rite, a rattan doll made by the Lan clan was found in his room, and people thought that the doll was cold and caused the owner's illness. In fact, this doll was made by Lan Yan and had the Sign of Vaisravana, one of the four main exorcism sigils, on it. She hoped that the doll would protect the guild owner and other patients with similar symptoms from the fetor. In addition, the craftswoman created rattan dolls to serve as a barrier on the border between life and death, through which monsters would not penetrate. When the director of the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor, Hu Tao, went to conduct a ritual that could clear the border and rid people of the fetor, Lan Yan made eight protective dolls in the form of Hu Tao and gave them to seven people to distribute the burden of the fetor and help the director.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Fontaine Research Institute
customize.desc: The Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering was founded by Alain Guillotin and is often shortened to simply the Fontaine Research Institute.

customize.name: Chenyu Adeptea
customize.desc: Tea grown in warm, moist areas in Chenyu Vale. After millennia of careful cultivation, the tea today emits a rich fragrance that can be savored from several streets away.

customize.name: Rattan Toy
customize.desc: A rattan toy left behind by someone, perhaps Lan Yan. It is slightly different from the ones at the fair, having a mysterious sigil stuck to it, indicating some other purpose.

customize.name: Rattan Toy: Hu Tao
customize.desc: A rattan figure that Lan Yan made specially for Hu Tao. It contains mysterious spellwork that can be used to distribute Fetor for the latter. However, due to your special relationship with the Ley Lines, your rattan figure cannot be linked up to the array...

customize.text:
Legend has it that a martial nomad, Guhua, was the master of the Rainslasher, a dimly fluorescent greatsword with no sharp edge. Years ago, it was known as the "Beacon of the Nether" by the mountain bandits, because seeing it meant there was no way back. Legend has it that Guhua was an Adeptus. While he lived, bandits dared not act and the wilderness knew a peace like that of the city. At the end of his journey, Guhua ascended to the heavens in a purple haze and became a star. After the Grand Master passed away, Master Baixuan, who once received his favor, established the Guhua Brotherhood in his name and called himself a disciple of Guhua to carry on the grand master's legacy. The disciples founded Wangshan Hall, which was known before as the "Lingmeng Chamber."
It was said that the Clan harbored three great secret arts — the ways of the "Light Piercer" for polearms, "Rain Cutter" for swords, and "Life Ender" for those who excelled in both. It is said that "Life Ender" could slice wind, split waves, and destroy mountains. The three arts would be refined over the generations, and with time would reach their apex. Yet the Clan's strength would continue to wane, leading to them losing their influence. The three arts became diamonds hidden in the rough, quietly awaiting a successor.

After many years of decline, Xingqiu from the Feiyun Commerce Guild became interested in the Guhua Clan. He successfully grasped the ancient "Martial Principle" after merely four years of study. Xingqiu thought that the basis of the polearm and sword was the use of a Vision. Martial artists were meant to see a Vision as an extension of themselves and see their weapon as an extension of the Vision. Having come to this epiphany, Xingqiu took up a quill and penned a verse on the Martial Principle, which has been sealed up at the Clan headquarters at Wangshan Hall.

<color=#ffffffd9>"Guhua's arts I have studied long, in its secrets I am trained, now its long-lost depths fall upon me like the coming of blessed rain.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>The beating heart of Guhua's sword art is as a shower of floating flowers. One amidst may seize a bloom, but those without read only doom.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>The Guhua lance is a lantern's dance, like flames in night's deep glooming. Like sparks, they scatter with ease in the dark, then join like the daybreak looming.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>They say the sword is as your arm — I say its glint is the beholder's eye, a light like the bright dawn coming.</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>Those who wander are burdened not. Freely they cut rain, and enlightened they pierce light. Like a snaking dragon, they cannot be subdued. In their right eye the blade, and in the other the spear."</color>

Unfortunately, Wangshan Hall, the main house of the Guhua Clan and where Grand Master Guhua attained enlightenment, became unusable, and even the current Master merely visits occasionally.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Adepti
customize.desc: Adepti are a group of immortal illuminated beasts of Liyue, who have protected people for millennia.

customize.name: Xingqiu
customize.desc: A young man carrying a longsword who is frequently seen at book booths. He has a chivalrous heart and yearns for justice and fairness for all.

customize.name: Rainslasher
customize.desc: A fluorescent greatsword with no sharp edge that crushes enemies with brute force and raw power.

customize.name: First Apprentice of Guhua
customize.desc: A novel by Chang the Ninth. Its thickness and weight say much about the effort he put in.

customize.text: When the Heavenly Principles declared war for the divine throne and rule of Teyvat, Fujin and Herblord's master fought against Morax. According to Fujin, her lord went mad seeking the position of a god who may rule this world, or she was simply trying to survive because she understood that she could not defeat Rex Lapis. In a desperate attempt to reverse fate, she caused the Bishui River to overflow its banks, destroying everything downstream. Herblord and Fujin could not allow people to die, so they went against their goddess.

According to legend, Herblord delayed the goddess with a battle, and Fujin threw the Votive Rainjade into the water, which stopped the river from flooding. Fujin released the Adeptal energy from the Jade Pendant to cause the ground to open up and swallow the Bishui River, allowing the Jademouth to grow and stabilize the flow. Lingyuan summoned her familiars, the Xuanwen beasts, to help her friends and drive the people into the caves. During the war, Fujin and Herblord spent all their energy, and Herblord lost the ability to take on her human form, leaving her trapped as a white snake.
Indigenous folks tell tales of how the mistress of Chenyu Vale started a war out of incurable obsession, before ultimately being defeated, sealed, and plunged into deathly, dreaming slumber, the relevant historical details can now no longer be verified. The sole piece of evidence that supports this tale is this song of lamentation that Chenyu Vale locals once sang:

<color=#ffffffd9>"Though I wish to gift you herbs, who shall leave it at the sandbank amidst the waters?"</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"Where now fly the godly banners? The chariot is lost in the lightless bamboo wood."</color>
<color=#ffffffd9>"How terrible the Xuanwen wail, who think upon the darkened pool."</color>

customize.name: Morax
customize.desc: The Geo Archon of Liyue.

customize.name: Xuanwen Beast
customize.desc:
Xuanwen Beasts, named for the dark patterns on their bodies, are fierce creatures that inhabit the mountains of Chenyu Vale.
In the region's folklore, these beasts were the servants of an adeptus in ancient times, tasked with vanquishing evil and protecting the region. However, they devolved into brutal creatures after said adeptus passed away. These legends cannot be verified, and no one knows the true identity of this adeptus. This much is for sure, however — one should stay away from these aggressive creatures for one's safety.
For over a thousand years, these beasts have lost a tremendous amount of territory that once belonged to them to relentless human encroachment. These days, they can only occasionally be spotted in the remote mountains of Chenyu Vale...

customize.text: Thousands of years later, when Herblord found her home in Liyue Harbor, and Fujin had not yet regained her powers and could not even take on human form, the Mountain Lord decided to return Chenyu lands to their state before the arrival of people. She believed that she, the carps, and the snakes all came from nature, so she wanted to return everything to the form that was at their birth. Then the rivers rose and fell with the rains, their paths were not fixed, the tea trees and flowers were not trimmed or cultivated, nor did they exist for humanity. Lingyuan believed that in such an environment, Fujin would regain her true carp form and spiritual strength and frolic in the great rivers. For many years, the Mountain Lord was changing the spirit veins, due to which the soil deteriorated, a thick fog arose, and miasma spread through the vale.

Fujin, who cares about the people of the vale, asked for the help of the Traveler to restore the spirit veins and change the soil. The Adeptus did not have enough strength to perform the Rainjade Rite herself, so she needed help. She didn't want Qiaoying Village, famous for its tea, to lose its reason for existence. Thanks to Traveler, Paimon, and Lingyuan's friend, Little Mao, Fujin was able to gain enough strength to perform a ritual on the sacred mountain and stop Lingyuan. The Suanni accepted defeat and, for the sake of her friend, agreed not to interfere with caring for people.

On the Chiwang Terrace, where all the spirit veins of Chenyu Vale converge, Fujin transmitted her Adeptal energy throughout the vale to restore the water and soil. Having spent all her powers on the ritual, she again lost the ability to take human form but was happy to return her friend and save people.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>
